condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Knowledge, political will and resources leveraged for the elimination of violence against children, and tools developed for the country and communities to enhance awareness and an enabling environment for reporting

description.narrative: UNICEF provided critical support to the Presidency to address violence against children (VAC) together with civil society, academia and private sector, resulting in the country's integrated GBV National Strategic Plan (NSP), which tables integrated programmes on prevention and response to violence against women and children; it is managed and coordinated at the President's offices demonstrating political will and commitment to ending violence against women and children. Work with the religious sector on social mobilization on child protection and reporting mechanisms led to the formation of a network among religious groups in various provinces. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of people who participate in social and behavior change communication interventions promoting elimination of VAC through UNICEF programmes

Country has a national, multi-sectoral plan(s) or strategy(ies) for coordinated action to prevent and respond to violence against children that meets key criteria for quality, according to status of plan.
Country routinely collects and publishes key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex
